Adjacency Table¶

class AdjacencyTable.AdjacencyTable(database)¶

An implementation of a tree using the Adjacency Table approach in sqlite. The tree contains two types of nodes, to represent items and categories. Categories can contain other categories and items, while items can only be leaf nodes. The following operations can be carried out:

  • adding new items (use new_item)

  • adding new categories (use new_category)

  • adding categories as subcategories of another category (use new_category)

  • assigning/reassigning items to a category (use categorise_item)

  • moving categories into another category (use move_category)

  • list all items that are descendants of a given node (use list_items)

  • list the direct children of a category, including both categories and items (use list_children)

  • list all categories (use list_categories)

categorise_item(item, category)¶
Description

Move an item into a category

Parameters

  • item – The id of the item

  • category – The id of the category

Returns

None

delete_category(category)¶
Description

Delete a category, moving it’s direct children to the root of the tree

Parameters

category – The category to delete

Returns

Boolean indicating whether delete was successful

delete_item(item)¶
Description

Delete an item

Parameters

item – The item to delete

Returns

Boolean indicating whether delete was successful

list_categories()¶
Description

Get a list of the ids and names of all categories

Returns

a list of the ids and names of all categories

list_children(parent=None)¶
Description

List all the direct children of a category

Parameters

parent – The parent category, defaults to None returning items and categories at the root of the tree

Returns

a list of the ids and names of the categories that are direct children and a list of the ids and names of the items that are direct children of the given category

list_items(category=None)¶
Description

List the id and name of all items in the given category or its descendants. If the category is None then all items are listed

Parameters

category – The id of the category

Returns

A list of the ids and names of items within the category

move_category(category, destination)¶
Description

Make one category a child of another category. Creation of loops is not permitted. All descendants of the moved category are now also descendants of the destination category. Setting destination to none will move the category to root.

Parameters

  • category – The id of the category you wish to move

  • destination – The id of the category you wish to make the category a child of

Returns

a boolean declaring whether the category was successfully moved. Returns False if one of the categories given as parameters is not valid, or when attempting to make a category a child of one of it’s own descendants.

new_category(name, parent=None)¶
Description

Create a new category

Parameters

  • name – Category Name. Must be unique

  • parent – Containing category if the new category is a sub category

Returns

None

new_item(name)¶
Description

Create a new item

Parameters

name – The name of the item you wish to create. Must be unique.

Returns

None
